channel.title: My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content on My New Hugo Site

item.title: K-12 Robotics
item.description: I participated in several competitive robotics programs in high school and continue to be involved in those communities with volunteering.

item.title: RoboJackets
item.description: I am a former president of this Georgia Tech student organization. I now mentor current leadership and help produce training materials.

item.title: Autonomous Fusion
item.description: Atlanta-based startup building autonomous driving software. I was a software engineer on the team building the autonomy systems.

item.title: Greenzie
item.description: Atlanta-based startup building autonomous lawnmowing tech. I worked on software for the first prototype and architecture for the future product.

item.title: ChatRover 9000
item.description: This project was my first substantial robotics project. It was a rather bulky and slow rover controlled via Skype. I entered into the GaETC tech fair in 2008, where it went on to win first in state.

item.title: Seekur Jr.
item.description: This project is from my internship at GTRI ELSYS in 2012. The project uses a kinect to autonomously map and navigate its environment.

item.title: Crowd Traffic
item.description: A mobile Android application that uses data from other app users to build a live map of traffic. Built during an internship at GSU’s Sensorweb Research Laboratory.

item.title: Spot
item.description: One of my early experiments in computer vision, this rover uses a webcam and on-board computer to chase balls and avoid crashes.

item.title: BassBot
item.description: As a final project for Georgia Tech’s CS 7633, Human-Robot Interaction, I built a bass guitar-playing robot.

item.title: VEX Shield for Arduino
item.description: This is an Arduino shield I’ve designed for making it easier to interface with VEX electronics (servos, sensors, etc.) from an Arduino microcontroller.

item.title: DIY Autonomous Car
item.description: Raspberry Pi-based, small scale, self-driving car.
